intro: Chorizanthe tenuis, commonly known as slender jointweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which aid in its propagation in harsh environments. Chorizanthe tenuis is often found in desert scrub and grassland ecosystems.
